text:
Dounia paced, her mind racing. 

“Rodya needs a job,” she said. 

She envisioned him as an associate. 

“Pyotr Petrovitch would pay him,” she thought. 

But doubts lingered. 

“Will university leave him time?” 

She glanced at Rodya, hopeful. 

“Trust me,” she whispered. 

“I’ll influence him,” she promised. 

They had plans. 

“Let’s not mention partnership yet,” she warned. 

Rodya nodded, uncertainty in his eyes. 

Dounia believed in them. 

“Everything will work out,” she assured. 

They just needed the right moment.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia is fervently planning for Rodya to work with Pyotr Petrovitch, believing it could lead to a partnership and financial support for his university studies.
